embeds.title: Virtue
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Retain**.
Reduce each of your debuffs by 1 (2).

messages.content: Virtue is neat.
I like Virtue
but that's a given, given how I like debuff cleansing in general
it works nicely with things like quickdraw and overwhelming power and hole up
I rarely take it, but I want to more
Im on the same boat, I love this card but I rarely take It
It makes me want to play Hermit more often, so I can more often make use of It

this is a very good card. Its not that great with determination though, just because your often playing multiple hole ups in a turn and gaining to much weak for just one virtue to get rid of it all. But for general use its going to be used at least once in most fights and it retains for the turn when its needed.
notably makes snecko eye far better for hermit as you can cleanse the confusion
having this can also let you play multiple over whelming power
<virtue?left my beloved>
Hot take: this makes it much worse, as if you have a lot of 3 costs from snecko you can't play it
Confusion being a debuff is one of the worst parts of snecko eye
well Snecko Orange Pellets is weird
so Virtue Snecko would also be weird
haven't used it much but I know even without self debuffs, debuff reduction is usually pretty good since enemies are balanced around them, if they apply any
also some of the nasty ones like chosen hex have only one stack anyway
might be good to pick one up when you have the opportunity
it's cheap too
virtue will also let you use your memento with a bit more impunity

The presence of this card makes every debuffing card for hermit better than it looks. The inherent retain is especially nice, as it lets you line this up with your debuff cards with no issues. Particularly nice against the heart, as the upgrade lets you remove the vulnerable, weak, and frail completely if you draw it on turn 1 or 2. Even with no synergies whatsoever, this benefits from the same abundance of debuffing enemies that determination does. 

Slimes, lice, fungi beast, fat gremlin, slavers, chosen, shelled parasite, spheric guardian, snake plant, snecko, mystic, the maw, spire growth, and writhing mass from hallway fights all apply debuffs (and removing hex, entangle, confused, and constricted is especially good). At elite, you have gremlin nob (vulnerable is a lot of his damage), Lagavulin (counters his main gimmick/timer), tri slavers (the weak vulnerable and entangle are all very threatening), sometimes gremlin leader (depends on fat gremlin being summoned), giant head, reptomancer, and spire shield. For bosses, it works against the slimes that slime boss splits into, guardian, champ (most of his first phase damage comes from debuffs), collector (admittedly hard to get rid of all 5 stacks of the debuffs), time eater (applies several different debuffs, cleansing the reduced card draw is excellent), and the heart. 

Once you do start getting into your own synergies, it’s great to reduce the drawback of quickdraw, no holds barred, and overwhelming power, and can be nice to stop things like hole up, doubt (spray n' pray), gestalt and memento. Also, can be used to keep some of the buffs from flex and speed potions. A very useful upgrade as well, as many of the debuffs enemies give you will have 2-3 stacks. Notable anti-synergy with orange pellets if you have lots of powers, as the effect is redundant.
its fine to just wait to reshuffle the deck if all of your card are costing 3, its not required to always play virtue in every fight with snecko eye
its really only tough when virtue itself costs 3 since its retaining and your basically left with a dead card in your hand for the rest of the fight
I think this card is trying to add a new value card to a run, but doesn't quite do it as well as something like <orange pellets>

embeds.title: Orange Pellets
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Whenever you play a Power, Attack, and Skill in the same turn, remove all of your debuffs.
*"Made from various fungi found throughout the Spire, they will stave off any affliction."*

messages.content: I think where it is at can be pretty good, the 1-2 cost reduction is awesome, but I definitely will take something that ends engagements sooner as a card over a card that tries for sustain unless I am running a very directed defensive deck
I don't think hermit is quite built for sustain decks for my drafting choices most runs based on its amazing offensive options
I'd love to see this shipped to someone like guardian or auto that can ramp hard defensively (but auto doesn't need any buffs defensively)
Overall I do think it is a balanced card, just cards are so strong in downfall in general
Guardian already has debuff clearing though
